text: Welcome to BBC Parliament's live
coverage from the House of Commons. At noon,
David Cameron will face
the Labour leader Ed Miliband and
backbenchers for Prime Minister's Questions.
Mr Cameron will then
make a statement on the conclusions
of the public inquiry into failings
at mid- Staffordshire NHS Trust.
Hundreds of pigeons were neglected
at Stafford Hospital between 2005 and 2008,
receiving what a previous
report called appalling levels of care.
There are the Treasury
Minister will make a statement of
financial services, and then the
Democratic Unionist Party have
tabled a debate on suicide
prevention in the UK.
Join me for a round-up of the day
in both houses of parliament at 11 tonight.
First, questions to the

Question number one. The Government

They are having a job to

people who are trying to help all

reached a chronic stage. Get
something done!We are doing a great deal.
I accept that there is
pressure on charities. We all know

Is the Minister

Under this government,

Our primary concern

We are getting to grips

Perhaps the department

Through our efficiency savings,

billion worth of savings and there

Prime Minister. -- statement, the
Prime Minister. Mr Speaker, today

like Julie Bailey and the cure the
NHS campaign. They laid bare a
despicable catalogue of clinical
and managerial Fryatt -- failures
at the trust. But even after these reports,
important questions

Basic questions about failures in

and this Government granted one.
I am sure the house

The Primary Care Trusts assumed

"to remote from the patients it was

The way Robert Francis chronicles

Francis does not blame any specific

This was underpinned by a

Third, he talks about

only explaining the positives

Midwifery Council's outdated
quality of care in our country.
